filmography.title: Criss Cross
filmography.role_description: An uncredited but memorable early appearance as a rumba dancer who catches the eye of Yvonne De Carlo.
filmography.plot: An armored truck driver returns to his hometown and conspires with his ex-wife to rob his own truck.

filmography.title: Winchester '73
filmography.role_description: A young soldier who encounters James Stewart's character; one of his first credited roles.
filmography.plot: A cowboy's obsession with a prize-winning rifle leads him on a chase through the Wild West.

filmography.title: The Prince Who Was a Thief
filmography.role_description: An Arabian prince raised by thieves who must reclaim his heritage; his first starring role in a swashbuckler.
filmography.plot: An assassin is sent to kill a baby prince but instead adopts him, raising him to be a master thief.

filmography.title: Houdini
filmography.role_description: The legendary magician and escape artist, starring alongside his real-life wife, Janet Leigh.
filmography.plot: A biography of the famous escape artist Harry Houdini, focusing on his romance with his wife and his dangerous stunts.

filmography.title: The Black Shield of Falworth
filmography.role_description: A headstrong peasant who trains to become a knight to reclaim his noble birthright.
filmography.plot: In medieval England, a peasant discovers he is of noble blood and must learn the ways of knighthood to clear his family's name.

filmography.title: Trapeze
filmography.role_description: An ambitious young acrobat who seeks out a crippled former star to teach him the elusive triple somersault.
filmography.plot: A crippled circus acrobat is torn between teaching a younger man the triple somersault and his love for the same woman.
filmography.awards: Berlin Int'l Film Festival: Win – Best Actor (Burt Lancaster)

filmography.title: Sweet Smell of Success
filmography.role_description: A desperate, sleazy press agent who will do anything to get into the good graces of a powerful columnist.
filmography.plot: Powerful but unethical Broadway columnist J.J. Hunsecker coerces a press agent into breaking up his sister's romance with a jazz musician.

filmography.title: The Vikings
filmography.role_description: A slave who discovers he is actually the half-brother of a Viking prince and vies for the throne and a princess.
filmography.plot: Einar and Eric are two half-brothers and rivals for the throne of Northumbria and the love of Princess Morgana.

filmography.title: The Defiant Ones
filmography.role_description: A white racist convict chained to a black prisoner (Sidney Poitier) as they escape and learn to rely on each other.
filmography.plot: Two escaped convicts, one white and one black, are shackled together and must learn to get along in order to elude capture.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; BAFTA: Nomination – Best Foreign Actor

filmography.title: Some Like It Hot
filmography.role_description: A jazz musician who disguises himself as a woman to hide from the mob, and also poses as a millionaire to woo Marilyn Monroe.
filmography.plot: Two male musicians witness a mob hit and flee the state in an all-female band disguised as women, but further complications set in.

filmography.title: Operation Petticoat
filmography.role_description: A resourceful, con-man supply officer who helps a submarine captain keep his damaged sub afloat.
filmography.plot: During World War II, a submarine commander finds himself stuck with a pink submarine, a con man executive officer, and a group of army nurses.

filmography.title: Spartacus
filmography.role_description: A Sicilian slave, singer, and poet who joins the gladiator rebellion and becomes a close friend to Spartacus.
filmography.plot: The slave Spartacus leads a violent revolt against the decadent Roman Republic.

filmography.title: The Great Impostor
filmography.role_description: The true story of a brilliant impostor who successfully impersonated a surgeon, a prison warden, and a monk.
filmography.plot: A brilliant young man successfully impersonates a variety of professionals, including a surgeon and a prison warden.

filmography.title: The Outsider
filmography.role_description: A dramatic portrayal of the Pima Native American Marine who helped raise the flag at Iwo Jima and struggled with post-war life.
filmography.plot: A biographical film about Ira Hayes, a Native American who fought in World War II and helped raise the flag at Iwo Jima.

filmography.title: Taras Bulba
filmography.role_description: The son of a Cossack leader who falls in love with a Polish noblewoman, leading to a tragic conflict of loyalties.
filmography.plot: A powerful Cossack leader fights for control of the steppes but faces a crisis when his son falls in love with the enemy's daughter.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Original Score

filmography.title: Captain Newman, M.D.
filmography.role_description: A wisecracking orderly in a military psychiatric ward who brings chaos and humor to the hospital.
filmography.plot: During World War II, a captain in the Medical Corps runs the psychiatric ward of an Army Air Corps hospital.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor (Gregory Peck)

filmography.title: Sex and the Single Girl
filmography.role_description: A tabloid magazine editor who impersonates his neighbor to seduce a famous psychologist author.
filmography.plot: A tabloid editor tries to expose the author of a guide for single women, but complications ensue when they meet.

filmography.title: The Great Race
filmography.role_description: A dashing, white-clad daredevil who races his arch-nemesis around the world in the early 20th century.
filmography.plot: A professional daredevil and a villainous arch-rival race from New York to Paris in the early 20th century.

filmography.title: Boeing, Boeing
filmography.role_description: A playboy journalist in Paris who juggles three stewardess fiancées with the help of a complicated flight timetable.
filmography.plot: A journalist living in Paris deceives three flight attendants into thinking they are each his one and only fiancée.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actor (Musical/Comedy) (Jerry Lewis)

filmography.title: Not with My Wife, You Don't!
filmography.role_description: An Air Force officer whose marriage is threatened by the arrival of his charming old rival.
filmography.plot: An Air Force colonel's happy marriage is disrupted when his old rival shows up and tries to steal his wife.

filmography.title: The Boston Strangler
filmography.role_description: A chilling, understated performance as the suspected serial killer, marking a significant departure from his comedic roles.
filmography.plot: Investigators search for the strangler who terrorized Boston in the early 1960s.

filmography.title: Monte Carlo or Bust!
filmography.role_description: An American con man who enters the Monte Carlo Rally in this slapstick comedy.
filmography.plot: An international group of drivers compete in the Monte Carlo Rally, facing sabotage and hijinks along the way.
filmography.awards: Also known as 'Those Daring Young Men in Their Jaunty Jalopies'

filmography.title: Lepke
filmography.role_description: The notorious head of the Murder, Inc. crime syndicate during the 1930s.
filmography.plot: The rise and fall of Louis 'Lepke' Buchalter, the only American mobster to ever be executed by the government.

filmography.title: The Last Tycoon
filmography.role_description: A polished Hollywood movie star in this adaptation of F. Scott Fitzgerald's final novel.
filmography.plot: A Hollywood studio executive slowly works himself to death while navigating industry politics and a doomed romance.

filmography.title: The Mirror Crack'd
filmography.role_description: An American film producer working in England who becomes a suspect in an Agatha Christie mystery.
filmography.plot: Miss Marple investigates when a local woman dies after drinking a poisoned cocktail intended for a visiting movie star.

filmography.title: Insignificance
filmography.role_description: A character based on Joseph McCarthy who harasses the other characters in a hotel room meeting of 1950s icons.
filmography.plot: Four 1950s cultural icons (Einstein, Monroe, DiMaggio, and McCarthy) converge in a hotel room to discuss life, the universe, and politics.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Technical Grand Prize
